meanings.definition: The act of making something less effective or valuable.
meanings.sent1: The vitiations of the document led to its rejection.
meanings.sent2: The vitiations in the system caused delays in production.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, the vitiations in his plan were evident.
meanings.sent4: The vitiations in her argument weakened her position significantly.
meanings.sent5: The vitiations in the painting were so severe that it lost all its charm.

meanings.definition: The process of corrupting or impairing something.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the vitiations of the data became apparent.
meanings.sent2: The vitiations of the environment were a result of human actions.
meanings.sent3: The vitiations in the software code caused unexpected errors.
meanings.sent4: The vitiations in his character slowly eroded his reputation.
meanings.sent5: The vitiations in the relationship were irreparable, leading to a breakup.

meanings.definition: The state of being spoiled or damaged.
meanings.sent1: The vitiations of the food were evident from its smell.
meanings.sent2: The vitiations in the fabric made it unwearable.
meanings.sent3: Despite attempts to hide it, the vitiations in the cake were obvious.
meanings.sent4: The vitiations in the wood gave it a weathered appearance.
meanings.sent5: The vitiations in the book made it unreadable.
